exit_code.description: Error occurred. Please check Tool Standard Error

param.name: infile_model
param.label: Models
param.help: Select a model file.

param.name: infile_data
param.label: Data (tabular)
param.help: Select the dataset you want to classify.

param.label: Exponent for inverse scaling learning rate
Use a copy of samples
param.help: If false, samples would be overwritten.

param.label: Solver to use in the computational routines
Number of trees in the forest
Minimum number of samples required to split an internal node

xml.name: min_samples_leaf
xml.token_label: Minimum number of samples in newly created leaves

param.label: Minimum weighted fraction of the input samples required to be at a leaf node
Maximum number of leaf nodes in best-first method
The threshold value of impurity for stopping node splitting
Use bootstrap samples for building trees.
Function to measure the quality of a split
Function to measure the quality of a split
Use out-of-bag samples to estimate the generalization error
max_features
param.option: I want to type the number in or input None type

param.name: num_max_features
param.label: Input max_features number:
param.help: If int, consider the number of features at each split; If float, then max_features is a percentage and int(max_features * n_features) features are considered at each split.

xml.name: verbose
xml.token_help: If 1 then it prints progress and performance once in a while. If greater than 1 then it prints progress and performance for every tree.

param.label: The fraction of samples to be used for fitting the individual base learners
Whether to presort the data to speed up the finding of best splits in fitting

xml.name: tol
xml.token_help_text: Early stopping heuristics based on the relative center changes. Set to default (0.0) to disable this convergence detection.

param.label: Estimate the intercept
param.help: If false, the data is assumed to be already centered.

xml.name: n_iter
xml.token_help_text: The number of passes over the training data (aka epochs).

xml.name: random_state
xml.token_help_text: Integer number. The seed of the pseudo random number generator to use when shuffling the data. A fixed seed allows reproducible results.

xml.name: warm_start
xml.token_help_text: When set to True, reuse the solution of the previous call to fit as initialization,otherwise, just erase the previous solution.

xml.name: C
xml.token_help_text: Penalty parameter C of the error term.

xml.name: alpha
xml.token_help_text: Constant that multiplies the regularization term if regularization is used.

xml.name: n_samples
xml.token_help_text: The total number of points equally divided among clusters.

xml.name: n_features
xml.token_help_text: Number of different numerical properties produced for each sample.

param.label: Standard deviation of the Gaussian noise added to the data

xml.name: C
xml.token_help_text: Penalty parameter C of the error term.

xml.name: max_iter
xml.token_label: Maximum number of iterations per single run

param.label: Number of runs with different centroid seeds
Centroid initialization method
param.help: ''k-means++'' selects initial cluster centers that speed up convergence. ''random'' chooses k observations (rows) at random from data as initial centroids.

param.label: Averaging type
param.option: Calculate metrics globally by counting the total true positives, false negatives and false positives. (micro)
Calculate metrics for each instance, and find their average. Only meaningful for multilabel. (samples)
Calculate metrics for each label, and find their unweighted mean. This does not take label imbalance into account. (macro)

Calculate metrics for each label, and find their average, weighted by support (the number of true instances for each label). This alters ‘macro’ to account for label imbalance; it can result in an F-score that is not between precision and recall. (weighted)

param.label: The strength of recall versus precision in the F-score

param.name: infile2
param.label: Dataset containing class labels or target values:

param.name: @COLUMN_OPTION@
param.label: Choose how to select data by column:
param.option: Select columns by column index number(s)
Select columns by column header name(s)
All columns but by column index number(s)
All columns but by column header name(s)

param.name: @COL_NAME@
param.label: Type header name(s):
param.help: Comma-separated string. For example: target1,target2

param.name: @COL_NAME@
param.label: Type header name(s):
param.help: Comma-separated string. For example: target1,target2

param.name: selected_input1
param.label: Select the input type of true labels dataset:

param.name: selected_input2
param.label: Select the input type of predicted labels dataset:

xml.name: multiple_input
xml.token_help_text: Specify a sparse matrix file in .txt format.

xml.name: sparse_target
xml.token_label2: Select the tabular containing true labels:

param.label: Weight function
param.help: Used in prediction.
param.option: Uniform weights. All points in each neighborhood are weighted equally. (Uniform)
Weight points by the inverse of their distance. (Distance)

param.label: Leaf size
param.help: Used with BallTree and KDTree. Affects the time and memory usage of the constructed tree.

param.label: Kernel type
param.help: Kernel type to be used in the algorithm. If none is given, ‘rbf’ will be used.

param.label: Degree of the polynomial (polynomial kernel only)
param.help: Ignored by other kernels. dafault : 3

param.label: Zero coefficient (polynomial and sigmoid kernels only)
param.help: Independent term in kernel function. dafault: 0.0

param.label: Enable probability estimates.
param.help: This must be enabled prior to calling fit, and will slow down that method.

expand.label: Solver maximum number of iterations
expand.help_text: Hard limit on iterations within solver, or -1 for no limit.
Integer number. The seed of the pseudo random number generator to use when shuffling the data for probability estimation. A fixed seed allows reproducible results.

param.label: Eigen solver
param.help: The eigenvalue decomposition strategy to use.

param.label: Kernel scaling factor
param.help: Scaling factor of RBF, polynomial, exponential chi^2 and sigmoid affinity kernel. Ignored for affinity=''nearest_neighbors''.

param.label: Affinity
param.help: Affinity kernel to use.

param.label: Number of neighbors
param.help: Number of neighbors to use when constructing the affinity matrix using the nearest neighbors method. Ignored for affinity=''rbf''

param.label: Assign labels
param.help: The strategy to use to assign labels in the embedding space.

param.label: Degree of the polynomial (polynomial kernel only)
param.help: Ignored by other kernels. dafault : 3

param.label: Zero coefficient (polynomial and sigmoid kernels only)
param.help: Ignored by other kernels. dafault : 1

expand.help_text: Early stopping heuristics based on normalized center change. To disable set to 0.0 .

param.label: Batch size
param.help: Size of the mini batches.

param.label: Maximum number of improvement attempts
param.help: Convergence detection based on inertia (the consecutive number of mini batches that doe not yield an improvement on the smoothed inertia). To disable, set max_no_improvement to None.

param.label: Number of random initialization samples
param.help: Number of samples to randomly sample for speeding up the initialization . ( default: 3 * batch_size )

param.label: Re-assignment ratio
param.help: Controls the fraction of the maximum number of counts for a center to be reassigned. Higher values yield better clustering results.

expand.help_text: Relative tolerance with regards to inertia to declare convergence.

param.label: Use a copy of data for precomputing distances
param.help: Mofifying the original data introduces small numerical differences caused by subtracting and then adding the data mean.

param.label: Subcluster radius threshold
param.help: The radius of the subcluster obtained by merging a new sample; the closest subcluster should be less than the threshold to avoid a new subcluster.

param.label: Maximum number of subclusters per branch
param.help: Maximum number of CF subclusters in each node.

param.label: Maximum neighborhood distance
param.help: The maximum distance between two samples for them to be considered as in the same neighborhood.

param.label: Minimal core point density
param.help: The number of samples (or total weight) in a neighborhood for a point (including the point itself) to be considered as a core point.

param.label: Metric
param.help: The metric to use when calculating distance between instances in a feature array.

param.label: Pointwise distance computation algorithm
param.help: The algorithm to be used by the NearestNeighbors module to compute pointwise distances and find nearest neighbors.

param.label: Leaf size
param.help: Leaf size passed to BallTree or cKDTree. Memory and time efficieny factor in tree constrution and querying.

param.name: selected_metric_function
param.label: Select the pairwise metric you want to compute:
param.option: Minimum distances between one point and a set of points

param.label: Axis
param.help: Axis along which the argmin and distances are to be computed.

param.label: Batch size
param.help: Number of rows to be processed in each batch run.

param.name: selected_pre_processor
param.label: Select a preprocessor:
param.option: Standard Scaler (Standardizes features by removing the mean and scaling to unit variance)
Max Abs Scaler (Scales features by their maximum absolute value)
Normalizer (Normalizes samples individually to unit norm)

expand.option: Minmax Scaler (Scales features to a range)
Polynomial Features (Generates polynomial and interaction features)
Robust Scaler (Scales features using outlier-invariance statistics)

param.label: Use a copy of data for precomputing binarization
Threshold
param.help: Feature values below or equal to this are replaced by 0, above it by 1. Threshold may not be less than 0 for operations on sparse matrices.

param.label: Use a copy of data for precomputing imputation
Imputation strategy
param.option: Replace missing values using the mean along the axis
Replace missing values using the median along the axis
Replace missing using the most frequent value along the axis

param.label: Placeholder for missing values
param.help: For missing values encoded as numpy.nan, use the string value “NaN”

param.label: Impute along axis = 1
param.help: If fasle, axis = 0 is selected for imputation.

param.label: Use a copy of data for performing inplace scaling
Scale the data to unit variance (or unit standard deviation)
Use a copy of data for precomputing scaling
The norm to use to normalize non zero samples
Use a copy of data for precomputing row normalization
Use a copy of data for precomputing normalization
The degree of the polynomial features
Produce interaction features only
param.help: (Features that are products of at most degree distinct input features)

param.label: Include a bias column
param.help: Feature in which all polynomial powers are zero

param.label: Scale the data to interquartile range
Use a copy of data for inplace scaling

param.name: input_mode
param.label: Construct a new estimator from a selection list?

param.name: input_mode
param.label: Construct a new estimator from a selection list?
cv
param.help: Optional. Integer or evalable splitter object, e.g., StratifiedKFold(n_splits=3, shuffle=True, random_state=10). Leave blank for default.

param.name: selected_algorithm
param.label: Select a feature selection algorithm
param.option: SelectKBest - Select features according to the k highest scores
SelectFromModel - Meta-transformer for selecting features based on importance weights
GenericUnivariateSelect - Univariate feature selector with configurable strategy
SelectPercentile - Select features according to a percentile of the highest scores
SelectFpr - Filter: Select the p-values below alpha based on a FPR test
SelectFdr - Filter: Select the p-values for an estimated false discovery rate
SelectFwe - Filter: Select the p-values corresponding to Family-wise error rate
RFE - Feature ranking with recursive feature elimination
RFECV - Feature ranking with recursive feature elimination and cross-validated selection of the best number of features
VarianceThreshold - Feature selector that removes all low-variance features

param.label: threshold
param.help: The threshold value to use for feature selection. e.g. 'mean', 'median', '1.25*mean'.

param.label: norm_order
param.help: Order of the norm used to filter the vectors of coefficients below threshold in the case where the coef_ attribute of the estimator is of dimension 2.

param.label: Parameter of the corresponding mode
param.help: float or int depending on the feature selection mode

param.label: Number of top features to select
param.help: No 'all' option is supported.

param.label: Alpha
param.help: The highest p-value for features to be kept.

param.label: Alpha
param.help: The highest uncorrected p-value for features to keep.

param.label: Alpha
param.help: The highest uncorrected p-value for features to keep.

param.label: n_features_to_select
param.help: The number of features to select. If None, half of the features are selected.

param.label: step
param.help: Default = 1.

param.label: verbose
param.help: Controls verbosity of output.

param.label: step
param.help: Default = 1.

param.label: verbose
param.help: Controls verbosity of output.

param.label: Threshold
param.help: Features with a training-set variance lower than this threshold will be removed.

param.label: Select a score function
param.option: chi2 - Compute chi-squared stats between each non-negative feature and class
f_classif - Compute the ANOVA F-value for the provided sample
mutual_info_classif - Estimate mutual information for a discrete target variable
mutual_info_regression - Estimate mutual information for a continuous target variable

param.name: selected_method
param.label: Select an output method:
param.option: fit_transform - Fit to data, then transform it
get_support - Get a mask, or integer index, of the features selected

param.name: indices
param.label: Indices
param.help: If True, the return value will be an array of integers, rather than a boolean mask.

param.name: primary_scoring
param.label: Select the primary metric (scoring):
param.help: Metric to refit the best estimator.

param.name: secondary_scoring
param.label: Additional scoring used in multi-metric mode:
param.help: If the same metric with the primary is chosen, the metric will be ignored.

param.name: secondary_scoring
param.label: Additional scoring used in multi-metric mode:
param.help: If the same metric with the primary is chosen, the metric will be ignored.

xml.token_help: Number of predispatched jobs for parallel execution

param.label: Choose the dataset containing pipeline object:

param.name: selected_param_type
param.label: Choose the transformation the parameter belongs to

expand.label: Pre_processing component #1 parameter:
expand.help: One parameter per box. For example: with_centering: [True, False].

expand.label: Pre_processing component #2 parameter:
expand.help: One parameter per box. For example: k: [3, 5, 7, 9]. See bottom for more examples

expand.label: Pre_processing component #3 parameter:
expand.help: One parameter per box. For example: n_components: [1, 10, 100, 1000]. See bottom for more examples

expand.label: Pre_processing component #4 parameter:
expand.help: One parameter per box. For example: n_components: [1, 10, 100, 1000]. See bottom for more examples

expand.label: Pre_processing component #5 parameter:
expand.help: One parameter per box. For example: affinity: ['euclidean', 'l1', 'l2', 'manhattan']. See bottom for more examples

xml.name: search_param_input
xml.token_help: One parameter per box. For example: C: [1, 10, 100, 1000]. See bottom for more examples

expand.help: Controls the number of jobs that get dispatched during parallel execution

param.label: iid
param.help: If True, data is identically distributed across the folds

param.label: refit
param.help: Refit an estimator using the best found parameters on the whole dataset.

param.label: Raise fit error:
param.help: If false, the metric score is assigned to 0 if an error occurs in estimator fitting and FitFailedWarning is raised.

param.name: selected_module
param.label: Choose the module that contains target estimator:

xml.name: estimator_params_text
xml.token_label: Type in parameter settings if different from default:
xml.token_help: Dictionary-capable, e.g., C=1, kernel='linear'. No double quotes. Leave this box blank for default estimator.
